description: TO PASS H.R. 1921, (APP. 12-17-03, 1-33 STAT. 34), A BILL FOR CARRYING INTO EFFECT A CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE REPUBLIC OF CUBA, SIGNED DEC. 11, 1902.  (P. 286-1)

TO AMEND A RESOLUTION THAT THE PRESIDENT BE REQUESTED TO INFORM THE SENATE WHETHER ALL THE CORRESPONDENCE AND NOTES BETWEEN THE DEPARTMENT OF STATE AND THE LEGATION OF THE U.S. AT BOGOTA, AND BETWEEN EITHER OF THESE AND THE GOVERNMENT OF COLUMBIA, FOR TH CONSTRUCTION OF AN ISTHMIAN CANAL, AND ALL THE CORRESPONDENCE AND NOTES BETWEEN THE U.S

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO S. 276 (33 STAT. 175, 4-13-04), A BILL PROVIDING FOR THE CELEBRATION OF THE 100TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE EXPLORATION OF THE OREGON COUNTRY BY LEWIS AND CLARK BY MAKING IT A CONDITION OF THE APPROPRIATIONS PROVIDED BY THIS ACT, THAT TE EXPOSITION THEREIN PROVIDED FOR BE CLOSED ON SUNDAYS
TO ADJOURN UNTIL MONDAY, FEB. 15, 1904.
TO RECOMMIT S. 1553, A BILL FOR PAYMENT TO EX-QUEEN LILIUOKALANI OF HAWAII TO THE COMMITTEE ON PACIFIC ISLANDS AND PUERTO RICO.  (P. 1927-2)
TO PASS S. 1553, N.P., A BILL AUTHORISING THE SECRETARY OF THE TREASURY TO PAY $150,000 TO LILIUOKALANI, FORMERLY QUEEN OF THE KINGDOM OF HAWAII.

TO AMEND THE TREATY CONCERNING THE CONSTRUCTION OF THE PANAMA CANAL, BY AGREEING THAT THE U.S. AND PANAMA MAKE A CERTAIN MONEY PAYMENT TO THE REPUBLIC OF COLUMBIA, AS FULL COMPENSATION FOR THE SURRENDER OF ITS SOVERINGNTY OVER THE TERRITORY EMBRACED IN TE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA, IN PAYMENT OF LAND FOR THE NEW PANAMA CANAL COMPANY AND THE PANAMA RAILROAD COMPANY, AND THE CONSTRUCTION OF A CANAL

TO ADVISE AND CONSENT TO THE RATIFICATION OF A CONVENTION BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE REPUBLIC OF PANAMA FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A SHIP CANAL TO CONNECT THE WATERS OF THE ATLANTIC AND PACIFIC OCEANS.  (P. 2261-1)
TO RECOMMIT S. 2263 (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. 518), TO THE COMMITTEE ON COMMERCE.  THE BILL PROVIDES FOR TRANSPORTATION OF SUPPLIES FOR ARMY AND NAVY; NO QUORUM VOTING.
TO RECOMMIT S. 2263.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROPOSED THAT IN CARRYING FREIGHT FOR PUBLIC PURPOSES, THE FREIGHT CHARGES MUST NOT EXCEED MORE THAN TEN PER CENTUM OF THE LOWEST BID OFFERED FOR TRANSPORTING SUCH FREIGHT IN FOREIGN BOTTOMS.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT ONLY VESSELS OF THE U.S. OR BELONGING TO THE U.S., FROM AND AFTER JULY 1, 1905, SHALL BE EMPLOYED IN THE TRANSPORT- ATION BY SEA, OF COAL, PROVISIONS, FODDER OR SUPPLIES OF ANY DESCRIPTION PRCHASED PURSUANT TO LAW, FOR THE USE OF THE ARMY OR NAVY

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR PREFERENCE FOR U.S. SHIPS TO CARRY FREIGHT FOR U.S. ARMY AND NAVY, PROVIDED THE CHARGES ARE NOT MORE THAN 25% IN EXCESS OF FOREIGN RATE.  (P. 2462-1)

TO TABLE THE AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE TRADE BETWEEN THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS AND THE U.S. BE CONTINUED AS AT PRESENT BY SUSPENDING THE APPLICATION OF THE TRADING LAWS OF THE U.S. FOR FIVE YEARS LONGER, UNTIL JULY 1, 1909.
TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES FOR THE EXCLUSION, AS EMPLOYEES ON SHIPS ACQUIRING BENEFITS UNDER THIS BILL, OF CHINESE, EXCEPT BONA FIDE RESIDENTS OF THE U.S.
TO AMEND S. 2263, BY INSERTING AT THE END OF SECTION ONE, A PROVISO THAT NONE BUT CITIZENS OF THE U.S. ARE TO BE EMPLOYED ON U.S. VESSELS BENEFITED BY THIS ACT.  (P. 2594-1)

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT FORBIDS FREIGHT CHARGES, PAID FOR TRANSPORTATION IN U.S. VESSELS FROM EXCEEDING BY MORE THAN 100% THE LOWEST BID OFFERED FOR SHIPMENT IN FOREIGN VESSELS.

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO S. 2263, WHICH AMENDMENT WOULD REQUIRE THE SECRETARIES OF THE ARMY AND NAVY TO REPORT ANNUALLY TO THE PRESIDENT ON THE TRANSPORTATION OF ARMY AND NAVY SUPPLIES AND THE COST OF SUCH TRANSPORTATION BY BOTH FOREIGN AND U.S. VESSELS ND, WHERE PREFERENCE IS GIVEN TO U.S

TO AMEND S. 2259, (APP. 4-15-04, 33 STAT. L. 181), A BILL REGULATING SHIPPING IN THE TRADE OF THE U.S. WITH THE PHILIPPINES, AND THE TRADE WITHIN THE PHILIPPINE ARCHIPELAGO, BY EXTENDING FROM JULY 1, 1904, TO JULY 1, 1909, THE TIME LIMIT FOR THE APPLICATON OF THE COASTWISE LAWS OF THE U.S

TO TABLE AMENDMENT TO S. 2259, (APP. 4-15-04,33 STAT. L 181) CONCERNING SHIPPING BETWEEN THE U.S. AND THE PHILIPPINES, WHICH SEEKS TO EXTEND FROM JULY 1, 1905, TO JULY 1, 1906, THE TIME WHEN ALL PASSENGERS AND MERCHANDISE TRANSPORTED BETWEEN THE U.S. ANDTHE PHILIPPINES SHALL BE LIMITED TO U.S

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12446, (4-21-04, 33 STAT. 234) A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR FORTIFICATIONS SO THAT THE AMENDMENT STIPULATES THAT THE SECRETARY OF WAR WILL BE ENABLED TO PURCHASE ONE SUBMARINE TORPEDO BOAT FOR EXPERIMENTAL PURPOSES, PROVDED THAT, THE SUBMARINE IS FULLY TESTED AND SUITABLE FOR COASTAL DEFENSE.
TO AMEND H.R. 12446, BY PROVIDING THAT THE SECRETARY OF WAR MAY PURCHASE ONE SUBMARINE FOR EXPERIMENTAL PURPOSES. (P. 3217-2)

TO AMEND AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 12446, WHICH AMENDMENT PROVIDES THAT THE SECRETARY OF WAR MAY PURCHASE A SUBMARINE FOR EXPERIMENTAL PURPOSES, PROVIDED THAT ONLY AMERICAN INVENTOR OR OWNER OF SUCH TYPE BOAT BE GIVEN AN OPPORTUNITY TO TEST SAME BY COMPARISONOR COMPETITION, AND THE RESULTS REPORTED TO THE SECRETARY OF WAR
TO PROVIDE THAT THE INJUNCTION OF SECRECY BE REMOVED FROM THE PROCEEDINGS ON THE NOMINATION OF BRIGADIER GENERAL LEONARD A. WOOD TO BE A MAJOR GENERAL IN THE U.S. ARMY.

TO AMEND H.R. 13521, (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. L. 429), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR SERVICE OF POST OFFICE DEPT. FOR FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1902, FOR OTHER PURPOSES. (P. 4484-1)

TO TABLE AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13521, WHICH AMENDMENT SEEKS TO CREATE A COMMISSION OF 5 SENATORS TO INVESTIGATE THE STATUS OF THE U.S. POSTAL LAWS.

TO AMEND H.R. 14416, (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. L. 452), A BILL MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR SUNDRY CIVIL EXPENSES OF THE GOVERNMENT FOR THE FISCAL YEAR ENDING JUNE 30, 1905, AND FOR OTHER PURPOSES, BY PROVIDING FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A FIREPROOF BUILDING FORTHE USE OF THE SENATE, NOT TO EXCEED $2,500,000.00 IN COST

TO PROCEED WITH CONSIDERATION OF H.R. 1700, N.P., A BILL RELATIVE TO RELIEF OF THE ESTATE OF WARREN MITCHELL.

TO DECIDE A POINT OF ORDER; WHETHER AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 13860 (APP. 4-28-04, 33 STAT. 441), THE MILITARY ACADEMY APPROPRIATION BILL, IS GERMANE.  THE AMENDMENT WOULD AUTHORIZE THE SECRETARY OF WAR TO ESTABLISH FOUR PERMANENT CAMP GROUNDS AND ENLARGE THECHICKAMAUGA NATIONAL PARK FOR THE INSTRUCTION AND MANEUVERS OF THE REGULAR ARMY AND NATIONAL GUARD TROOPS.

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, (APP. 2-6-05, 33 STAT. L. 689) AN ACT TO AMEND SEVERAL ACTS REGARDING THE CIVIL GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS, BY ELIMINATING THAT PART OF SECTION ONE, WHICH PROPOSES TO MAKE ALL BONDS TAX EXEMPT ISSUED BY THE PHILIPPINE GOVERMENT, OR UNDER ITS AUTHORITY.

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, BY PROPOSING TO HAVE THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMENT GUARANTEE THE INTEREST ON RAILROAD BONDS AT THE RATE OF 3% INSTEAD OF 4% PER YEAR, AND TO REDUCE THE ANNUAL CONTINGENT LIABILITY FROM $1,200,000 TO $900,000. (P. 360-1)

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, AUTHORIZING THE GENERAL GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINE ISLANDS THE RIGHT OF REGULATING CHARGES FOR FREIGHT AND PASSENGER SERVICE ON RAILROAD COMPANIES WHOSE INTEREST ON BONDS IS GUARANTEED; AND BEFORE ANY RAILROAD COMPANY CAN ISSUE ANYSTOCKS OR BONDS, SAME MUST BE APPROVED BY THE PHILIPPINE COMMISSION

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, BY AUTHORIZING THE PHILIPPINE GOVERN- MENT TO GUARANTEE, NOT EXCEEDING FOUR PER CENT PER ANNUM, THE INTEREST ON BONDS OF ANY RAILROAD COMPANY, AUTHORIZED BY THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMENT TO BUILD AND EQUIP RAILROAD, THE GUARANTEE OF INTEEST TO LAST THIRTY YEARS

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, (APP. 2-6-05), BY RELEASING THE U.S. GOVERNMENT FROM LIABILITY ON BONDS THAT MAY BE ISSUED BY THE GOVERNMENT OF THE PHILIPPINES, OR BY ANY MUNICIPAL OR OTHER SUB-DIVISION THEREOF, UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT.

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, BY ELIMINATING AMENDMENT WHICH PROPOSED TO AUTHORIZE THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMENT TO GUARANTEE FOR THIRTY YEARS, NOT EXCEEDING FOUR PER CENT PER ANNUM, THE INTEREST ON BONDS OF ANY RAILROAD COMPANY AUTHORIZED BY THE PHILIPPINE GOVERNMEN TO BUILD AND EQUIP A RAILROAD.

TO AMEND H.R. 14623, BY ADDING A NEW SECTION PROPOSING THAT ONE-HALF OF THE ENTIRE UNAPPROPRIATED PUBLIC DOMAIN IN THE SAID ISLAND IS HEREBY SET APART AS A PERMANENT SCHOOL FUND FOR THE INHABITANTS OF THE PHILIPPINES.

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY INSERTING AS PART OF THE CONSTITUT- ION OF THE PROPOSED NEW STATE CONSISTING OF THE PEOPLE OF OKLAHOMA AND INDIAN TERRITORY, A SECTION WHICH WOULD MAKE IT A MISDEAMOR PUNISHABLE BY FINE AND IMPRINSONMENT TO MANUFACTURE, SELL, BARTR OR GIVE AWAY ANY INTOXICATING BEVERAGE, THIS SECTION TO BE IN EFFECT FOR 21 YEARS AFTER ADMISSION OF SAID STATE

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY STRIKING OUT CERTAIN SECTIONS INCLUSIVE AND INSERTING NEW SECTIONS IN LIEU THEREOF, PROPOSING A NEW STATE TO BE CALLED NEW MEXICO, BUT LEAVING OUT ALL REFERENCE TO THE TERRITORY OF ARIZONA, ON THE GROUND THAT THERE WERE ENOUGH PEOLE IN THE TERRITORY OF NEW MEXICO TO FORM A STATE WITHOUT INCLUDING ARIZONA

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY STRIKING OUT ALL AFTER THE ENACTING CLAUSE, UP TO THE AMENDMENT JUST ADOPTED AND IN LIEU THEROF INSERT A NEW AMENDMENT FOR THE ADMISSION OF OKLAHOMA AS ONE STATE, OMITTING THE INDIAN TERRITORY AS PART OF OKLAHOMA. (P. 1995-2,1997-)

TO TABLE AMENDMENT TO H.R. 14749, WHICH PROPOSED TO SUBMIT TO A DIRECT VOTE OF THE PEOPLE OF EACH TERRITORY THE QUESTION OF MAKING ONE STATE OUT OF THE TERRITORY OF OKLAHOMA AND THE INDIAN TERRITORY, REQUIRING A MAJORITY VOTE IN BOTH TERRITORIES TO MAKE NE STATE OF BOTH TERRITORIES

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY ADDING A PROVISO TO ANNEX THAT PORTION OF ARIZONA TERRITORY LYING NORTH AND WEST OF THE CENTER OF THE COLORADO RIVER TO FORM A PART OF THE STATE OF UTAH, WITH ITS CONSENT.  (P. 2000-2)

TO AMEND H.R. 14749, BY STRIKING OUT ALL OF CERTAIN SECTIONS AND INSERTING NEW SECTIONS IN LIEU THEREOF, PROPOSING THAT A NEW STATE BE MADE OUT OF THE TERRITORY OF NEW MEXICO BUT LEAVING OUT ALL REFERENCE TO THE TERRITORY OF ARIZONA, ON THE GROUND THAT TERE ARE ENOUGH EPOPLE IN N.M
